items.sentence: Tom looked around the dark room with a flashlight.
I looked all around, but I could see nobody there.
I must speak to you about what your son did today.
It\'s been a long time since I\'ve sung that song.
Was Tom supposed to be at this morning\'s meeting?
Was your high school\'s baseball team a good team?
We had hoped that the rain would stop before noon.
Tom has volunteered to go to Boston to help there.
I\'m sure you\'ve already discussed this with Tom.
Tom didn\'t want to write about what had happened.
Tom doesn\'t know what the homework assignment is.
My guess is that Tom isn\'t going to want to sing.
Please don\'t accuse me of something I didn\'t do.
Tom spilled a cup of coffee all over his keyboard.
Tom stole a car in Boston and drove it to Chicago.
Tom stood in front the mirror, looking at himself.
If you want to be happy, make somebody else happy.
Tom certainly knows a thing or two about business.
Tom told me he thought that Mary would be curious.
I can\'t understand why Tom would want to do that.
